p:
The anti-HSV-1 activities of the Indian medicinal plant Swertia chirata were examined by Verma et al.
161 Water extracts using dried powder of the leaves and stems of the plant were prepared to a total concentration of 1 g/ml. Subsequent dilutions and treatment to cells showed that the extract inhibited plaque formation by more than 70% at a dilution of 1:64. Adding the extract at 4, 8, and 24 hours after infection showed the greatest reduction in infected cells at 4 hours. Additionally, no genetic material amplification was found at 12, 24, 48, or 72 hours after simultaneous HSV-1 infection and S. chirata treatment.
